summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message from Pastor Tyshone Roland about waiting on God's promises! Isn't it incredible how God works in our timing, not just our own? Drawing from Hannah's story in 1 Samuel, Tyshone shares a deeply personal and inspiring message about holding onto hope even when circumstances seem impossible. He vulnerably shares his own journey of waiting, including losing family members and holding onto prophetic words that seemed delayed. The sermon is a beautiful reminder that God's 'due season' isn't always when we expect it, but it's always perfect. Sometimes all we have is a word, a promise, and the faith to keep believing. Pastor Tyshone challenges us to keep praying, even when we're bitter, to give God glory in all seasons, and to worship Him regardless of our current circumstances. His personal testimony of receiving a prophetic word at 20 and seeing it fulfilled years later is a powerful testament to God's faithfulness. The message resonates with anyone who has ever felt stuck waiting for a promise, offering hope and encouragement that God is working behind the scenes, even when we can't see it.
mainPoints: Pray even when you're bitter, and that bitterness will turn to better
Always give God the glory for your breakthroughs
Worship God in every season, not just when things are going well

versesMentioned.text: The full narrative of Hannah's story of requesting a child from God
Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a longing fulfilled is a tree of life.
Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.
And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 27:14: 'Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord.'
Monday.focus: Understanding the power of patient waiting
Monday.action: Create a journal entry about a promise or dream you're currently waiting on. Write down how you feel about waiting and ask God to give you peace and perspective.
Monday.prayer: Lord, teach me patience. Help me to trust Your timing and not my own. Give me the strength to wait on You with hope and faith. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Isaiah 40:31: 'But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.'
Tuesday.focus: Renewing strength through hope in God
Tuesday.action: Identify one area of your life where you've grown weary. Spend time in prayer asking God to renew your strength and perspective.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, renew my strength today. Where I am tired and discouraged, fill me with Your hope and energy. Help me to trust in Your promises. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Wednesday.focus: Trusting God's plans over our own
Wednesday.action: Make a list of your current hopes and dreams. Surrender each one to God, asking Him to align your desires with His purpose.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I surrender my plans to You. Help me trust that Your plans are better than anything I could imagine. Give me wisdom to follow Your leading. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Romans 8:25: 'But if we hope for what we do not yet have, we wait for it patiently.'
Thursday.action: Practice an intentional act of patience today. This could be listening more, waiting without complaining, or showing grace in a challenging situation.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me develop patience. Show me areas where I need to slow down and trust Your timing. Give me a peaceful heart that can wait on You. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Philippians 1:6: 'Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.'
Friday.action: Reflect on past promises God has fulfilled in your life. Write them down as a reminder of His faithfulness.
Friday.prayer: Faithful God, thank You for Your consistent work in my life. Help me remember Your past faithfulness when I'm tempted to doubt Your current promises. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Habakkuk 2:3: 'For the revelation awaits an appointed time; it speaks of the end and will not prove false. Though it linger, wait for it; it will certainly come and will not delay.'
Saturday.action: Create a 'promise box' where you write down your current hopes and prayers. Place them in the box as a symbolic act of surrendering them to God.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, I trust Your timing. Help me to wait with hope, knowing that You are always working, even when I cannot see. Fill me with peace and expectation. Amen.
